questions.q: Which radioisotope is most commonly used in myocardial perfusion imaging?
questions.explanation: Technetium-99m is the most commonly used isotope for myocardial perfusion imaging due to its ideal half-life and energy characteristics

questions.q: What is the most appropriate nuclear medicine study for diagnosing pulmonary embolism?
questions.explanation: Ventilation/Perfusion (V/Q) scan is a nuclear medicine study specifically designed to detect pulmonary embolism

questions.q: Development stage:
questions.A: Testosterone is secreted by Sertoli cells
questions.B: Anti-müllerian hormone is secreted by Leydig cells
questions.C: Anti-müllerian hormone is responsible for involution of normal müllerian system
questions.D: Anti-müllerian hormone is not responsible for involution of normal müllerian system
questions.explanation: Anti-müllerian hormone is responsible for involution of the normal müllerian system. Testosterone is produced by Leydig cells and AMH is produced by Sertoli cells

questions.q: Bicornuate uterus can cause all of the following EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Congenital anomalies are associated with a genetic origin rather than a structural one

questions.q: In Turner’s syndrome patients, all of the following are true EXCEPT:
questions.A: The streak ovaries should be removed surgically due to 25% tendency to be malignant
questions.B: Are usually less than 5 feet tall
questions.E: Have normal but infertile external genitalia

questions.q: The adnexa uteri include all of the following EXCEPT:
In the development of external genitalia:
questions.A: Genital tubercles form the labia minora
questions.B: Genital smoothing forms the labia majora
questions.C: Genital fold forms the scrotum in males
questions.D: Chlydrotestone is essential for the muscularity of external genitalia
questions.E: Müllerian system develops into external genitalia

questions.q: Congenital uterine malformations cause all of the following EXCEPT:
Ovarian dysgenesis is associated with the elevation of which of the following hormones:
Confirmation of the diagnosis of Turner syndrome is best done by:
In cases of androgen insensitivity syndrome the following findings are true EXCEPT:
questions.B: Scant or no pubic or axillary hair
questions.explanation: The patients have a normal male karyotype of XY chromosome

questions.q: In testicular feminization syndrome:
questions.B: Kallmann's syndrome is a recognized cause
questions.D: There's usually very low testosterone level

questions.q: In Turner's syndrome, the following are usually observed EXCEPT:
questions.A: The ovaries are usually well developed
questions.C: The girl is of short stature
questions.E: The condition can be diagnosed by chromosomal analysis

questions.q: Regarding the development of internal genital organs:
questions.A: The uterus, fallopian tubes, cervix & upper vagina develop from the mesonephric duct
questions.B: The testes secrete testosterone which causes regression of the müllerian ducts in the male fetus
questions.C: The vagina is formed by the urogenital sinus
questions.D: Müllerian agenesis (Mayer-Rokitansky-Kuster-Hauser syndrome) is characterized by the absence of the uterus & upper vagina with normal female external genitalia & 46 XX
questions.E: Bicornuate uterus & uterus didelphys result from vertical fusion defects of the müllerian ducts

questions.q: Regarding puberty, all of the following are true EXCEPT:
questions.A: It is the transitional period of development during which an individual matures from childhood to sexual & reproductive maturity
questions.B: Breast budding is the first visible sign of puberty
questions.C: The maximum growth velocity occurs at 12 years
questions.D: The age of menarche has decreased over the last 3-4 decades due to improved nutrition, general health & lifestyle changes
questions.E: Thelarche marks the attainment of reproductive maturity

questions.q: Turner's syndrome is associated with:
questions.explanation: One of the clinical presentations of Turner syndrome is primary amenorrhea

questions.q: Anomalies of the uterus can be associated with the following EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Polycystic ovary is a condition of the ovaries, not the uterus

questions.q: First endocrine influence in secondary sexual characteristics:
questions.A: Secretion of delta-4 androstenedione from the adrenal gland

questions.q: Follicular growth (in a non-ovulating follicle) is usually followed by:
The normal sequence of pubertal changes in the female is:
questions.explanation: The sequence of pubertal changes in women starts with thelarche and ends in menarche

questions.q: The barr body is:
questions.B: The darkest, widest band found on chromosomes
questions.C: One extra lobe on the female polymorphonuclear leukocytes
questions.E: The largest chromosome in the female genotype

questions.q: The most common cause of precocious puberty is:
questions.explanation: The most common cause of precocious puberty is idiopathic

questions.q: The normal sequence of puberty is:
The luteal phase of the menstrual cycle is associated with:
questions.explanation: The development of the corpus luteum after ovulation leads to an increase in progesterone levels

questions.q: The follicular phase of the menstrual cycle is characterized by:
questions.explanation: The follicular phase is characterized by the endometrial lining growth and gland proliferation

questions.q: A sample of cervical mucus is taken on day 12 of the menstrual cycle. The mucus is thin, clear, & stretchy. It is placed on a slide and allowed to air dry. When placed under a microscope, what would you expect:
questions.B: Clear fields, devoid of bacteria cells
questions.D: A fern pattern characteristic of estrogen

questions.q: Estrogen hormone is produced from all of the following organs EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: The anterior pituitary produces FSH, which stimulates the release of estrogen from the ovaries

questions.q: The midcycle LH surge:
An involuted corpus luteum becomes a hyalinized mass known as a:
Which of the following is the best method to predict the occurrence of ovulation:
questions.A: Thermogenic shift in basal body temperature

questions.q: Luteal phase deficiency:

On examination of endometrial tissue obtained from a biopsy, it reveals simple columnar epithelium with no subnuclear vacuoles. The stroma is edematous, & a tortuous gland contains secretions. These findings are consistent with which stage of the menstrual cycle:
Ovulation occurs:
questions.D: After follicles ripened in the ovary
questions.explanation: Ovulation occurs 36 hours after LH surge

questions.q: Regarding estrogen hormone:
questions.A: It is produced in the corpus luteum
questions.B: It is responsible for secretory changes in the endometrium
questions.C: It is mainly secreted as E3 by the ovary
questions.D: Cannot be detected in the blood of postmenopausal women
questions.explanation: The corpus luteum primarily produces progesterone but also produces estrogen

questions.q: Regarding human chorionic gonadotropin, all of the following are true EXCEPT:
questions.A: It is produced by the placenta
questions.B: It is responsible for the maintenance of the corpus luteum
questions.C: Its level doubles every 48 hours in ectopic pregnancy
questions.D: Reaches a peak concentration in maternal serum by 10 weeks gestation
questions.E: Forms the main tumor marker for trophoblastic neoplastic diseases

questions.q: Endometrial changes during the menstrual cycle:
questions.A: The basal layer of the endometrium is responsive to hormonal stimulation
questions.B: The functional layer of the endometrium remains intact throughout the menstrual cycle
questions.C: The increased thickness of the endometrium during the proliferative phase is due to estrogen action
questions.D: Estrogen induces secretory changes in the endometrium & reduces mitotic activity
questions.E: The zona compacta & spongiosum layer the basal layer of the endometrium

questions.q: Inadequate luteal phase is associated with all of the following EXCEPT:
questions.A: Insufficient secretion of FSH in the antecedent follicular phase
questions.B: Induction of ovulation with Clomiphene citrate
questions.C: Induction of ovulation with human menopausal gonadotropins
questions.D: Administration of progesterone in the luteal phase

questions.q: In the days after ovulation, all of the following occur EXCEPT:
questions.D: Cervical mucus becomes more viscous & scanty
questions.explanation: There is an increase in the production of progesterone due to the development of the corpus luteum
